instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - System does not recognize battery
threads.message:
Logic board is clean but not working!

PPBus was 8.16v. I tried a reflow in the SMC, passed to 8.56V and Mac worked, but died minutes later.

I changed the SMC and it worked, but it did not start the system! So I tried a clean BIOS, system started, but it does not recognize the battery.

System does not show battery icon and in information, this as "no battery". But if I shot charger, the Mac gets on for a few seconds.

I tested with other batteries. I suspect the SMC or the BIOS file.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - System does not recognize battery
threads.message:
Put back original BIOS.
It should be good, if machine worked few minutes after refllowed SMC.
Did you reball original SMC, or changed it directly?

Actual <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage is correct?
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is 0V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - System does not recognize battery
threads.message:
Bios, I tried to go back to the original, but it didn't turn on, I think there was a problem with the backup. Tried other files, same result.

Original SMC, I tried reflow after reballing, but PPBus was left at 8.16. So replace the SMC, now PPbus is 8.56v.

<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is 0.20v

Another information, it does not turn on only with the battery (charged). Only with magsafe.

Model 2014, has ASD? I'm looking for another SMC to test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - System does not recognize battery
threads.message:
I checked the PPBus again, it dropped again to 8.16! =/

but it still works, just with battery problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - System does not recognize battery
threads.message:
Incorrect <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, will not charge the battery.

Check diode mode and voltage at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
ASD 3S156 is the version you need.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - System does not recognize battery
threads.message: Got another SMC and it worked. I'll test it and if I have a problem again, I'll be back!
